description: From Old French acoustumer, acustumer (Modern French accoutumer) corresponding to a (“to, toward”) + custom. More at custom, costume.

verbs.description: accustom (third-person singular simple present accustoms, present participle accustoming, simple past and past participle accustomed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, often passive or reflexive) To make familiar by use; to cause to accept; to habituate, familiarize, or inure. [+ to (object)]
examples: If you visit Italy, you'll need to get accustomed to the slower pace of life and the fact that most shops won't be open at lunch time.
all of them accustoming , once in the year , to take their kind of the fresh water
